dt: {bc}a quality, character, or characteristic ascribed to someone or something
{bc}an object closely associated with or belonging to a specific person, thing, or office

dt.t: a scepter is the {wi}attribute{/wi} of power

dt: {bc}such an object used for identification in painting or sculpture

pt: {sc}quality{/sc} {sc}property{/sc} {sc}character{/sc} {sc}attribute{/sc} mean an intelligible feature by which a thing may be identified. {sc}quality{/sc} is a general term applicable to any trait or characteristic whether individual or generic.
{sc}property{/sc} implies a characteristic that belongs to a thing's essential nature and may be used to describe a type or species.
{sc}character{/sc} applies to a peculiar and distinctive quality of a thing or a class.
{sc}attribute{/sc} implies a quality ascribed to a thing or a being.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}attributus{/it}, past participle of {it}attribuere{/it} to attribute, from {it}ad-{/it} + {it}tribuere{/it} to bestow {ma}{mat|tribute|}{/ma}
shortdef: a quality, character, or characteristic ascribed to someone or something
an object closely associated with or belonging to a specific person, thing, or office; especially : such an object used for identification in painting or sculpture
a word ascribing a quality; especially : adjective

dt.t: He {it}attributed{/it} his success to hard work.

dt: {bc}to regard as a characteristic of a person or thing

dt.t: should not {wi}attribute{/wi} adult reasoning to children

dt: {bc}to reckon as made or originated in an indicated fashion

pt: {sc}ascribe{/sc} {sc}attribute{/sc} {sc}assign{/sc} {sc}impute{/sc} {sc}credit{/sc} mean to lay something to the account of a person or thing. {sc}ascribe{/sc} suggests an inferring or conjecturing of cause, quality, authorship.
{sc}attribute{/sc} suggests less tentativeness than {sc}ascribe{/sc}, less definiteness than {sc}assign{/sc}.

pt.t: {it}attributed{/it} to Rembrandt but possibly done by an associate

pt: {sc}assign{/sc} implies ascribing with certainty or after deliberation.

pt.t: {it}assigned{/it} the bones to the Cretaceous period

pt: {sc}impute{/sc} suggests ascribing something that brings discredit by way of accusation or blame.

pt.t: tried to {it}impute{/it} sinister motives to my actions

pt: {sc}credit{/sc} implies ascribing a thing or especially an action to a person or other thing as its agent, source, or explanation.

shortdef: to explain (something) by indicating a cause
to regard as a characteristic of a person or thing
to reckon as made or originated in an indicated fashion
